title: Reasons for eating fast food in the U.S. as of August 2014
summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Response, and Share of respondents in each Response on the y axis.
The Share of respondents is highest at Response Convenient and lowest at Response Other.
There is a difference of 61.6 between the maximum Response Convenient and minimum Response Other.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The maximum Share of respondents 67.2 is found at Response Convenient and the minimum is found at Other where Response is 5.6.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Response, and Share of respondents in each Response on the y axis.
The Share of respondents is highest at Response Convenient and lowest at Response Other.
There is a difference of 61.6 between the maximum Response Convenient and minimum Response Other.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
Response Convenient has the highest Share of respondents and Other has the lowest Share of respondents.
Second maximum Share of respondents is found at Response Cheap.
The lowest value at Response Other is 12.0x times less than the highest value at Convenient.
The Response Convenient has the highest Share of respondents, followed by Cheap, and I just like it. Down to the Response Other which is the lowest.
The Response Convenient tends to be 2.27 percent higher than average.
